intro: Zeylanidium crustaceum, commonly known as the golden ghost shrimp, is a small, translucent crustacean found in freshwater environments. It belongs to the family Laevivordera and is characterized by its unique, elongated body and distinctive golden coloration. This species is often observed in the genus Zeylanidium, which includes several similar aquatic crustaceans. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems as a detritivore, feeding on algae and organic debris. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes kept in aquariums as a观赏 species.
